publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1201 Nick Johnston: Business AM—That the Parliament congratulates Business AM on its first edition and, in welcoming this new paper, applauds the extension of choice for newspaper readers in Scotland.
S1M-1201 Business AM (lodged on 20 September 2000) Mr Brian Monteith*, David Mundell*

S1M-1201 Nick Johnston: Business AM—That the Parliament congratulates Business AM on its first edition and, in welcoming this new paper, applauds the extension of choice for newspaper readers in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, David Mundell
S1M-1201 Business AM (lodged on 20 September 2000) Fergus Ewing*, Alex Fergusson*
S1M-1201 Business AM (lodged on 20 September 2000) Euan Robson*
S1M-1201 Business AM (lodged on 20 September 2000) Cathy Peattie*, Phil Gallie*

S1M-1201 Nick Johnston: Business AM—That the Parliament congratulates Business AM on its first edition and, in welcoming this new paper, applauds the extension of choice for newspaper readers in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, David Mundell, Fergus Ewing, Alex Fergusson, Euan Robson, Cathy Peattie, Phil Gallie, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1201 Business AM (lodged on 20 September 2000) Alex Neil*, Michael Russell*, Brian Adam*, Christine Grahame*

S1M-1201 Nick Johnston: Business AM—That the Parliament congratulates Business AM on its first edition and, in welcoming this new paper, applauds the extension of choice for newspaper readers in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, David Mundell, Fergus Ewing, Alex Fergusson, Euan Robson, Cathy Peattie, Phil Gallie, Mr Adam Ingram, Alex Neil, Michael Russell, Brian Adam, Christine Grahame
S1M-1201 Business AM (lodged on 20 September 2000) Tricia Marwick*, Andrew Wilson*

S1M-1201 Nick Johnston: Business AM—That the Parliament congratulates Business AM on its first edition and, in welcoming this new paper, applauds the extension of choice for newspaper readers in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, David Mundell, Fergus Ewing, Alex Fergusson, Euan Robson, Cathy Peattie, Phil Gallie, Mr Adam Ingram, Alex Neil, Michael Russell, Brian Adam, Christine Grahame, Tricia Marwick, Andrew Wilson
S1M-1201 Business AM (lodged on 20 September 2000) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-1201 Business AM (lodged on 20 September 2000) Mary Scanlon*

S1M-1201 Nick Johnston: Business AM—That the Parliament congratulates Business AM on its first edition and, in welcoming this new paper, applauds the extension of choice for newspaper readers in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, David Mundell, Fergus Ewing, Alex Fergusson, Euan Robson, Cathy Peattie, Phil Gallie, Mr Adam Ingram, Alex Neil, Michael Russell, Brian Adam, Christine Grahame, Tricia Marwick, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mary Scanlon

S1M-1201 Nick Johnston: Business AM—That the Parliament congratulates Business AM on its first edition and, in welcoming this new paper, applauds the extension of choice for newspaper readers in Scotland.
